item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (297 points | 38 comments)
2. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (74 points | 9 comments)
3. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (248 points | 79 comments)
4. NYC Subway Station Layouts (121 points | 49 comments)
5. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (153 points | 61 comments)
6. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (121 points | 55 comments)
7. Archaeologists Puzzled by Skeleton of Bones of People Who Died 1000's Yrs Apart (7 points | discuss)
8. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (322 points | 69 comments)
9. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (71 points | 26 comments)
10. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (85 points | 11 comments)
11. Grim Fandango (121 points | 38 comments)
12. Verbalize – text editor with writing assistance for Brazilian Portuguese (5 points | discuss)
13. A mod that turns TI-84 calculators into GPT-based cheating device (13 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (247 points | 43 comments)
15. When machine learning tells the wrong story (77 points | 4 comments)
16. You too can write a book (72 points | 23 comments)
17. Texture-Less Text Rendering (179 points | 46 comments)
18. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (414 points | 164 comments)
19. Stargate built 15 years ago in Ohio 50k pounds concrete family time (15 points | 9 comments)
20. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (313 points | 143 comments)
21. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (244 points | 102 comments)
22. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (164 points | 73 comments)
23. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (154 points | 52 comments)
24. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (139 points | 49 comments)
25. Notes on Guyana (111 points | 102 comments)
26. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
27. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (89 points | 45 comments)
28. A Brief History of Cyrix (68 points | 13 comments)
29. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (286 points | 129 comments)
30. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (41 points | 13 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
